messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] How to apply unschooling to 18 year old stepson's...
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/29/2005 2:51:32 AM Central Standard Time, lovelifenyc@aol.com writes: don t  have much experience in this area....other than me being a
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/29/2005 2:51:32 AM Central Standard Time,
lovelifenyc@... writes:

don't have much experience in this area....other than me being a teen
myself once who partied a bit.


~~~
He's 18. Does he still have to go to school? Has he graduated? Does he
want to go to college?

I'd just leave him be...maybe encourage him to get a job, get out and make
friends. Get the local free weekly paper and help him find interesting things
to do, like concerts or whathaveyou. If he's interested in reading it, get
him The Teenage Liberation Handbook.

He's in a huge transition, moving from one country to another, and then just
being 18 with a schooled history. Is there any hurry for him to be on some
sort of track?

Karen

www.badchair.net


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
